definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: Mr Charles was elected (the) chairman of the municipal education committee.
sentences.chinese: 查爾斯當選爲先生市教育委員會主任委員。

sentences.english: Hiss election to the presidency climaxed his political career.
sentences.chinese: 他的當選爲總統使他的政治生涯達到最高峯。
但羅斯福成功地再次當選。

sentences.english: Abbott has said if elected he would improve relations between Australia and India, including the sale of uranium.
sentences.chinese: 阿博特曾表示，當選後會增進澳印關係，包括售鈾。

sentences.english: President-elect Obama is in Hawaii, where he was born and raised.
sentences.chinese: 當選總統奧巴馬則在夏威夷，他生長的地方。

sentences.english: 1976 elected fellow , the society of designer - craftsmen.
sentences.chinese: 1976年，當選爲設計師，手工藝者學會會員。

sentences.english: She became first lady of the United States in nineteen ninety-three, after Bill Clinton was elected president.
sentences.chinese: 她成爲在九三年美國第一夫人，在克林頓當選總統。

sentences.english: The successful candidate will be announced at a public session of the World Health Assembly on that same day.
sentences.chinese: 當選者將在同一天世界衛生大會公開會議上宣佈。

sentences.english: In 1889 Annie Besant was elected to the London School Board .
sentences.chinese: 在1889年安妮貝贊特當選爲倫敦學校董事會。

sentences.english: The United States, Britain and the United Nations issued statements congratulating President Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 美國，英國，聯合國都發表聲明，祝賀卡爾扎伊當選。

sentences.english: But he might also have forfeited his chance of a second term.
sentences.chinese: 不過他也有可能喪失下屆當選的機會。

sentences.english: Tony Tan wins Singapore presidential election .
sentences.chinese: 陳慶炎當選新加坡新總統。

sentences.english: Of those 20 players, 14 have never made an All-Star team.
sentences.chinese: 這20名球員中，14人已經當選過全明星。

sentences.english: Prior to his election, Benedict had a reputation for learning and piety.
sentences.chinese: 據記載在他當選之前他以其憐憫和好學而著稱。

sentences.english: John's chance of being elected chairman of the committee is far greater than Dick .
sentences.chinese: 約翰當選爲委員會主席的可能性比迪克大得多。

sentences.english: The elder judge finally decided that either Sara or May would get the position.
sentences.chinese: 年長的評審官最後決定當選者要麼是薩拉，要麼是梅。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
